fields.description:
euca-describe-nodes and euca_conf --list-nodes provide incorrect information. Here is a list of the registered nodes:

{code}
# grep NODES /etc/eucalyptus/eucalyptus.conf
NODES="10.0.0.61 10.0.0.65 10.0.0.54 10.0.0.55 10.0.0.67 10.0.0.56 10.0.0.57 10.0.0.58 10.0.0.60 10.0.0.62 10.0.0.63 10.0.0.64 10.0.0.66 10.0.0.68 10.0.0.69 10.0.0.59"
{code}

Examples of mismatches are as follows:

* euca-describe-nodes verbose

{code}
 euca-describe-nodes verbose
NODE	10.0.0.54	cloud3-cc-001	i-FDBC4431	i-D3073FF5	i-8D5340E0	i-75194953	i-281741A4	i-124D3F94	i-AF5F413F	i-8EF13CAF

NODE	10.0.0.58	cloud3-cc-001	i-1C7C410C	i-B8B2423D	i-25A7468F	i-86094522	i-85663F38	i-81823D47	i-B9D240FB	i-FFB34480	i-192D3E83	i-BC9B43A7	i-18D8422E
NODE	10.0.0.59	cloud3-cc-001	i-167842A1	i-90D93F56	i-FE3F4373	i-15F33FFD
{code}

fields.summary: euca-describe-nodes does not return consistent results
fields.environment:
*HA Environment*

2 x CLC/Walrus
2 x CC/SC
16 x NC

comments.body:
Hi Harold,
Have you reproduced this in house? What is the minimal environment you can reproduce this in?

Hi Michael,

When I ran into this issue, the cloud had at least 14 NCs. I think in order to reproduce this, you will need at least that many NCs under a single cluster, and launch instances to fill up all the resources on the NCs to run into this issue.  Hope this helps.  Please let me know if you need any additional help in regards to reproducing this issue.

Cheers,

Harold Spencer, Jr.
Did you see this on a customers system or did you reproduce this in house? Is this only seen with HA?
Hi Yes we see it also with non ha setups.
Thanks Teeemu!  What is the minimal setup you see it in?

Hey Michael,

I ran into it on a customer's setup.  It was a non-HA setup.  Hope this helps.

Cheers,

Harold Spencer, Jr.
I have not seen it in 1-2 nc test clouds. Will check tomorrow if I can see it in 2 az x 4 nc cloud. 12 nc definetely reproducable.

On 2 az 6 nc each we have relatively stable result in quiet period, but immediately when we start instances to there (10 in this case) we start to see fluctuation in number of nodes.

[root@e1001~]# euca_conf --version
eucalyptus 3.2.0

[root@e1001 ~]# euca_conf --list-nodes
NODE    10.1.4.41     e_1_cc

Teemu, do you see this only with multiple clusters or do you see with just one cc as well?

Ok, I have it reproduced in house with 16 instances running on the following.

machine00 CLC WS CC00 SC00
machine01 NC01 NC02 NC03 NC04 NC05 NC06 NC07 NC08 NC09 NC10 NC11 NC12

Now I will find out why?

Code Review Request : EUCA-3456 euca-describe-nodes does not return consistent results

Hi All,

May I please request a code review for EUCA-3456 euca-describe-nodes does not return consistent results

branch : dev/mmunn1/EUCA-3456

diff :  git show --color 895058cb618b0c9fb70a094d7c6993c63076cde2

summary: "euca-describe-nodes" and  "euca_conf --list-nodes" were both randomly returning an incomplete listing of nodes.
The problem occured more frequently with larger numbers of nodes. The problem was in updateNodeInfo( final List<NodeType> nodeTags )
where the first for loop was removing all the servicetags due to faulty logic and the second for loop was adding them all back on every call. his was 
causeing the the NavigableSet returned by Cluster.getNodeTags( ) to change unneccessarly. This was in turn resulting in inconsistent results
for euca-describe-nodes.


solution: I changed the first for loop in updateNodeInfo( final List<NodeType> nodeTags ) to remove only the unmatched service tags.
Now only newly registered and unregistered nodes will be updated.

Unit test :
I have created eutester/testcases/clour_admin/Euca3456

import unittest
import shutil
from eucaops import Eucaops

import unittest
import shutil
from eucaops import Eucaops

class Euca3456(unittest.TestCase):

    def setUp(self):
        #This bug is intermittent.
        #To reproduce this consistently I used 6 nodes 24 instances and 50 iterations
        #These can be adjusted, the more nodes and instances the quicker you will see the problem.
        #runInstances is run twice for a total of (2 * numIntances ) this done
        #to avoid out of resources error.
        self.numNodes = 6
        self.numIntances = 12
        self.numIterations = 50
        self.conf = "cloud.conf"       
        self.tester  = Eucaops( config_file=self.conf, password="foobar" )
        self.doAuth()

    def tearDown(self):
        self.tester.cleanup_artifacts() 
        self.tester.delete_keypair(self.keypair)
        self.tester.local("rm " + self.keypair.name + ".pem") 
        shutil.rmtree(self.tester.credpath) 
         
    def runInstances(self, numMax):
        #Start instance
        self.reservation = self.tester.run_instance(keypair=self.keypair.name, group=self.group, min=1, max=numMax, is_reachable=False)
        # Make sure the instance is running       
        for instance in self.reservation.instances:
            if instance.state == "running":
                self.ip = instance.public_dns_name
                self.instanceid = instance.id
                
    def runSysCmd(self, cmd):
        self.source  = "source " + self.tester.credpath + "/eucarc && "
        self.out = self.tester.sys(self.source + cmd) 
         
    def doAuth(self):
        self.keypair = self.tester.add_keypair()
        self.group = self.tester.add_group()
        self.tester.authorize_group(self.group)

    def testDescribeNodes(self):
        self.emi = self.tester.get_emi()
        self.runInstances(self.numIntances)
        self.runInstances(self.numIntances)
        i = 0
        while i < self.numIterations :
            i += 1
            self.tester.debug("Running iteration " + str(i))
            self.runSysCmd("/opt/eucalyptus/usr/sbin/euca_conf --list-nodes")
            #count the returned nodes
            count = str(self.out).count("NODE")
            if count != self.numNodes :
                self.tester.debug("FAILURE only " + str(count) + " nodes listed.")
                self.fail("FAIL Incorrect number of nodes listed!")
            else :             
                self.tester.debug("SUCCESS " + str(count) + " nodes listed.")
                pass
            
if __name__ == "__main__":
    unittest.main("Euca3456")

Thx Mike
Tested manually and with EuTester test case EUCA-3456. Fix works!. Approved fix for Release.
3.2.2 has been released, moving this to Resolved.
